messages.content: The moon is approximately 240,000 miles from the earth.  It takes 24 hours for the moon to orbit the earth.  The gravitational forces between the moon and the earth cause the tides in the ocean.

The moon is approximately 240,000 miles from the earth.  It takes 24 hours for the moon to orbit the earth. The gravitational forces between the moon and the earth cause the tides in the ocean.  The tides in the ocean are called the tidal cycle.  It consists of the phases of new, full, half-full, quarter-full, and new.  The gravitational forces are most effective when the moon is closest to the earth, thus causing the largest tides when the moon is full.
no there is a laser that checks the distance from the moon to the earth what was the reading for the distance to the moon in the year 2020 using the laser distance
an estimate of the distance to the moon using a laser was approximately 240,000 miles
